name: market for lignite briquettes factory | lignite briquettes factory | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/3839/documentation

This is a market activity. In the case of services or immobile infrastructures, markets are connecting suppliers and consumers at a global level. For specific connections at regional level, direct links between the local producing activities and the local consumers are preferred. Transport or losses are logically not relevant for this type of products.;This is the market for  'lignite briquettes factory', in the Global geography.;This market contains no transport or losses, as they are irrelevant for the delivered product.;This is an immobile infrastructure, representing the construction of lignite briquettes factory. An annual production of 2 million t and a lifetime of 30 years are assumed. Coke ovens are either autonomous plants located near mines or are operated close to smelters. The infrastructure comprises a large number of ovens, which are operated for around 20 hours per charge and therefore have a low throughput. The further processing of raw gas and tar also requires facilities that are comparable to a small chemical plant. The area accounted for the power plant is estimated as 2*105 m2 . Briquette factories are usually connected to a power plant, which supplies the heat for drying. TThe process includes the most important construction materials for the plant and their decommission, land use and energy consumption for the construction. 

This activity starts with the built infrastructure ready to use.

This activity ends with the infrastructure made accessible to the users. Transport or losses are considered irrelevant for this product.
